column4: any way to make USB volumes mount automatically upon being plugged in?
also why do USB volumes mount automatically on my Desktop and not on my laptop? Both are running Karmic ...
/dev/<device> /media/<mountpoint> auto user,defaults 0 0
also check nautilus > edit > preferences > behavior tab first; easier if it works
I don't know what is default in nautilus; maybe they changed something; shouldn't be difficult though
edit /usr/share/gdm/autostart/LoginWindow/libcanberra-ready-sound.desktop
seriously ... this was doable through a graphical frontend before ... are we going forward or backward!? :P
there is no gui by default for gdm2, but check gdm2setup on launchpad.net
it doesn't provide an option to change the sound, only toggle the drums on/off; edit the file or replace the sound in /usr/share/sounds/ubuntu/stereo
I see ... well I have the file open ... how do i turn it off?
change the exec= line, delete or replace everything behind the =
can i comment it out in case i want to revert the change?
sure, but maybe add another line with just "exec=" to be sure
oh yes ... good idea
you guys must spend so much time with Linux to know it so well inside and out ... my hats off to you ... i have been using Ubuntu as my main OS for 4 years and still cannot seem to catch up ... ha
nah, it's just something lots of people want to configure, so this is a FAQ
I see ... are people like me an whine about having to do it through the command line?
in this case, no; but cli is very convenient: you get explanations and useful error messages most of the time

agreed ... I just have a number of clients who I have switched from Windows to Ubuntu who are not too pleased when i tell them they have to resort to the terminal to do something so seemingly simple ... this is the main reason I groan ... not because I myself mind all that much, in fact i rather enjoy the command line, but because I am thinking of the greater group of users ... :)
those client should maybe stick with LTS releases; karmic has some new stuff that isn't completely configurable / packed with features yet
yes, about a quarter of them are still using Hardy ... but the remainder want the latest whenever they can get it ... hehe ...
